titleStmt.title: Aprill the first, 1642. A continuation of the tryumphant and cou[ra]gious proceedings of the Protestant army in Ireland. Containing divers great overthrowes given to the rebels, w[ith] the slaying and taking prisoners of some of the chiefe in rebellion[,] whose heads by proclamation were rated at 400. li. a peece. Also the manner how the rebels consecrated Kildar[e] church. Together, with an order from the House of Commons, unto th[e] shrieffes of each county.

Aprill the first, 1642. A continuation of the tryumphant and cou[ra]gious proceedings of the Protestant army in Ireland. Containing divers great overthrowes given to the rebels, w[ith] the slaying and taking prisoners of some of the chiefe in rebellion[,] whose heads by proclamation were rated at 400. li. a peece. Also the manner how the rebels consecrated Kildar[e] church. Together, with an order from the House of Commons, unto th[e] shrieffes of each county.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

notesStmt.note: Cropped, with loss of text; bracketed material conjectured by cataloger.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
